result.execSummary:
The defendant Barry M Jones Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
*   Pay restitution which will be set on 2/15/2017 at 1:30 p.m. by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*** 2/20/2017, Judge Siefert; Court sets restitution at zero.***
*   Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Barry M Jones Jr

Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Barry M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. Court sets restitution at zero.

Defendant Barry M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for restitution hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 47.  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 20, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Barry M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 


Defendant sentenced to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, STRAIGHT TIME. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Pay restitution which will be set on 2/15/2017 at 1:30 p.m.
          by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *   No new arrests.       
     *   Pay all mandatory costs, fees, surcharges by the end of probation.
          Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.






  Restitution hearing scheduled for February 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Barry M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Barry M Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense requests projected guilty plea date.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea  12-07-2016 atr 8:30am,in Branch 47.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON (10/05/2016). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Barry M Jones in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office.  Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Barry M Jones not in court.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, recompense is not an issue.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/13/15 @ 1:30pm
